com.paydiant.android.core.facade

Interface ISecurityManagerFacade

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SecurityManagerFacade

    public interface ISecurityManagerFacade
    Interface for the SecurityManagerFacade.
    Author:
    Paydiant Inc.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean deleteDevice(DeleteDevice device)
      Delete device.
      boolean expireDeviceAuthToken()
      Expires the long lived session device authentication token.

      Generates a device authentication token for long lived sessions.

      Returns any additional information related to the user device/login which returned after a successful loginByUserName(DeviceSecurityProfile) or loginWithPin(DeviceSecurityProfile) call.

      This method first registers the device if it is not already registered and then validates the user using the PIN and logs in the user.

      Logout.

    • Method Detail

      • loginByUserName

        String loginByUserName(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
        This method first registers the device if it is not already registered and then validates user credentials and logs in the user.
        Parameters:
        deviceSecurityProfile - - instance of DeviceSecurityProfile which encapsulates both the user credentials and device information.
        Returns:
        Returns true of login is successful or false if login fails.

      • loginWithPin

        String loginWithPin(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
        This method first registers the device if it is not already registered and then validates the user using the PIN and logs in the user.
        Parameters:
        deviceSecurityProfile - - instance of DeviceSecurityProfile which encapsulates both the user credentials (PIN) and device information.
        Returns:
        Returns true of login is successful or false if login fails.

      • logout

        void logout()
        Logout.

      • deleteDevice

        boolean deleteDevice(DeleteDevice device)
        Delete device.
        Parameters:
        device - the device
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • getAdditionalAttributes

        Map<String,String> getAdditionalAttributes()
        Returns any additional information related to the user device/login which returned after a successful loginByUserName(DeviceSecurityProfile) or loginWithPin(DeviceSecurityProfile) call. This may include the additional information such as the last login date, last login status, force password change etc. This would return null, if there aren't any additional information available.
        Returns:
        A key-value map containing the additional information related to the user device/login, if available, or null.
        Since:
        4.0.0.1
        See Also:
        DeviceFingerprint.getAdditionalAttributes(), loginByUserName(DeviceSecurityProfile), loginWithPin(DeviceSecurityProfile)

      • loginByNonce

        DeviceSecurityProfile loginByNonce(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
        Logs in the user using a nonce. Returned response's DeviceSecurityProfile.getLoginStatus() property will contain whether the login was successful (LoginStatus.LOGIN_SUCCESS, failed ( LoginStatus.LOGIN_SUCCESS or MFA answer required (LoginStatus.MFA_ANSWER_REQUIRED. If status is ( LoginStatus.MFA_ANSWER_REQUIRED, then this method will need to be called again with the relevant DeviceSecurityProfile.setQuestionAndAnswer(com.paydiant.android.core.domain.QuestionAndAnswer) properties populated.
        Parameters:
        deviceSecurityProfile - - Initial call will require nonce and device properties populated. To provide MFA answers, use the returned DeviceSecurityProfile with questionAndAnswer properties populated.
        Returns:
        the device security profile response with the relevant DeviceSecurityProfile.getLoginStatus()
        Throws:
        PaydiantException - PaydiantException or an instance of a child PaydiantException class with the following statusCodes

        400(BAD_REQUEST) - Invalid arguments.
        401(UNAUTHORIZED) - Authentication Failed.
        415(UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE) - Invalid application signature.
        418(I_AM_A_TEAPOT) - User email not verified.
        421(DESTINATION_LOCKED) - Customer deactivated.
        423(LOCKED) - Device deactivated (due to consecutive failed login attempts).
        426(UPGRADE_REQUIRED) - Invalid app SDK version.
        500 (INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR) -Internal server error.
        503(SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE) - Device suspended.
        511(NETWORK_AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED) - Application Instance Not Verified Error
        Since:
        5.3.0.2
        See Also:
        ISecurityManagerService.getDeviceFingerprintTemplateByFederatedIdentity(DeviceSecurityProfile), ISecurityManagerService.loginByFederatedIdentity(DeviceSecurityProfile)

      • loginByFederatedIdentity

        DeviceSecurityProfile loginByFederatedIdentity(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
        Logs in the user using the information retrieved from identity service provider. Returned response's DeviceSecurityProfile.getLoginStatus() property will contain whether the login was successful ( LoginStatus.LOGIN_SUCCESS, failed (LoginStatus.LOGIN_SUCCESS or MFA answer required ( LoginStatus.MFA_ANSWER_REQUIRED. If status is (LoginStatus.MFA_ANSWER_REQUIRED, then this method will need to be called again with the relevant DeviceSecurityProfile.setQuestionAndAnswer(com.paydiant.android.core.domain.QuestionAndAnswer) properties populated.
        Parameters:
        deviceSecurityProfile - - Initial call will require authorizationCode, identityProvider and device properties populated. To provide MFA answers, use the returned DeviceSecurityProfile with questionAndAnswer properties populated.
        Returns:
        the device security profile response with the relevant DeviceSecurityProfile.getLoginStatus()
        Throws:
        PaydiantException - PaydiantException or an instance of a child PaydiantException class with the following statusCodes

        400(BAD_REQUEST) - Invalid arguments.
        401(UNAUTHORIZED) - Authentication Failed.
        415(UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE) - Invalid application signature.
        418(I_AM_A_TEAPOT) - User email not verified.
        421(DESTINATION_LOCKED) - Customer deactivated.
        423(LOCKED) - Device deactivated (due to consecutive failed login attempts).
        426(UPGRADE_REQUIRED) - Invalid app SDK version.
        500 (INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR) -Internal server error.
        503(SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE) - Device suspended.
        511(NETWORK_AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED) - Application Instance Not Verified Error
        Since:
        5.3.0.2
        See Also:
        ISecurityManagerService.getDeviceFingerprintTemplateByFederatedIdentity(DeviceSecurityProfile), ISecurityManagerService.loginByFederatedIdentity(DeviceSecurityProfile)

      • isAuthorizationTokenExist

        boolean isAuthorizationTokenExist()
        Checks whether the long lived session is enabled or not.
        Returns:
        true if long lived session enabled (i.e. Device authentication token generated.)
        Since:
        6.1.0.1.a

      • generateDeviceAuthToken

        DeviceSecurityProfile generateDeviceAuthToken(DeviceSecurityProfile deviceSecurityProfile)
        Generates a device authentication token for long lived sessions.
        Parameters:
        deviceSecurityProfile - - DeviceSecurityProfile object containing the UserCredentials object's username & password properties populated.
        Returns:
        DeviceSecurityProfile with device authentication token populated.
        Throws:
        PaydiantException - PaydiantException or an instance of a child PaydiantException class with the following statusCodes
        400(BAD_REQUEST) - Login by device auth token is not supported by issuing partner and application id
        401(UNAUTHORIZED) - Authentication failed
        403(FORBIDDEN) - Not Authenticated
        412(PRECONDITION_FAILED) - Device not registered/not linked
        413(REQUEST_ENTITY_TOO_LARGE) - Device deactivated

        PaydiantEntityReponseException - PaydiantEntityReponseException with the following statusCode, errorInformation.errorCodes
        401(UNAUTHORIZED), 419 - Authentication failed
        400(BAD_REQUEST), 432 - Login by device auth token is not supported by issuing partner and application id
        Since:
        6.1.0.1.a

      • loginByDeviceAuthToken

        boolean loginByDeviceAuthToken()
        Logs in using device authentication token parameters
        Returns:
        true if successfully logged in.
        Throws:
        PaydiantException - PaydiantException or an instance of a child PaydiantException class with the following statusCodes
        400(BAD_REQUEST) - Login by device auth token is not supported by issuing partner and application id
        401(UNAUTHORIZED) - Authentication failed due to invalid token or exceeding maximum number login attempts. (Use PaydiantEntityReponseException errorInformation.errorCode to identify the exact reason)
        421(DESTINATION_LOCKED) - Customer deactivated error
        423(LOCKED) - Device deactivated error

        PaydiantEntityReponseException - PaydiantEntityReponseException with the following statusCode, errorInformation.errorCodes
        400(BAD_REQUEST), 432 - Login by device auth token is not supported by issuing partner and application id
        401(UNAUTHORIZED), 419 - Authentication failed due to invalid token
        401(UNAUTHORIZED), 494 - The Mobile Device is deactivated due to exceeding maximum number login attempts.
        Since:
        6.1.0.1.a

      • expireDeviceAuthToken

        boolean expireDeviceAuthToken()
        Expires the long lived session device authentication token.
        Returns:
        true if the current device authentication token successfully expired.
        Throws:
        PaydiantException - PaydiantException or an instance of a child PaydiantException class with the following statusCodes
        400(BAD_REQUEST) - Invalid arguments
        412(PRECONDITION_FAILED) - Device not registered/not linked
        413(REQUEST_ENTITY_TOO_LARGE) - Device deactivated
        403(FORBIDDEN) - Not Authenticated

        PaydiantEntityReponseException - PaydiantEntityReponseException with the following statusCode, errorInformation.errorCodes
        400(BAD_REQUEST), 403 - Invalid arguments
        Since:
        6.1.0.1.a
